name: The Chateau and Orangery of the Nievre Valley
description:
DESCRIPTION
To celebrate your wedding, treat yourself to the best: the luxury and comfort of a magnificent castle to receive your family and friends. Your photos will be spectacular and your memories unforgettable. This brick and stone castle is classified as a Historic Monument. It has a large park made up of various themed gardens, a wood, meadows, a vegetable garden and a swimming pool.
In the Orangery of the Château, two majestic rooms with large connections can accommodate up to 190 seated or 300 standing people. This capacity can be increased by adding marquees. A large cloakroom and a kitchen for catering are part of the set.
Many shops and restaurants are located around the Castle. Depending on availability, the Château can offer a table d'hôtes service.
For before and after the wedding your guests can enjoy various sports activities can be practiced nearby (cycling, fishing, kayaking, sand yachting, kite-surfing, etc.) but also cultural outings such as: discovery of Amiens and its cathedral, Saint-Riquier and its abbey, Long and its castle, etc.).
The beaches of the Opal Coast are located 40 minutes from the venue so perfect for a little day trip whilst here.
The architecture of the Castle, inherited from the concepts of the Italian Renaissance, favours light. It is thus oriented North-South so that the interior rooms benefit from the double exposure to light. The Château has a pyramidal ground plan, high French roofs with great quality in the size of its stone harps, in slight chamfered bosses, standing out against a brick wall.
The Orangery, a superb brick and stone building, has an area of approximately 350m². This Orangery is divided into two large reception rooms which are widely connected, the first of which is adorned with a majestic fireplace. A large kitchen, a cloakroom and amenities complete the package. With its huge glass doors, the Orangery faces the English garden. This area can host a secular ceremony or the cocktail party if the weather does not allow it in the gardens.
At the southern end of the English-style garden is the Gallery: this sheltered space of approximately 160m² can accommodate guests outside if the weather is unfavorable.
All the rooms in the Château are unique. The refined decoration and comfort are praised by our guests. A clever mix of old and new creates a warm atmosphere and the magic happens. The 5 bedrooms in the 18th century wing have been recently renovated. Two lodgings (6 people and 2 people) give our guests real independence. In the event of privatization, the Château can accommodate up to 50 people .
The Château is surrounded by different green spaces with very varied atmospheres. The Jardin la Française with its boxwood, basin and symmetrical paths, offers a breathtaking 180 ° view of the Nièvre valley. The English Garden in front of the Orangery, stretches out in a profusion of flowers; roses, hydrangeas and other species follow one another throughout the seasons. The Cour d'Honneur preceded by a majestic portal bearing the arms of the family, extends over a green lawn surrounded by cobblestones and impressive cannonballs. Le Clos boisé is an alley embellished by superb conifers where ornamental hens roam free. To the west of the Château, a space to walk in the shade and discover the famous purple beech….
On sunny days, the sun illuminates the vegetable garden and its heated swimming pool. A large terrace of 300 m2 surrounds this basin.
This space is designed for tranquillity, sport and relaxation; it is also possible to have a meal there while enjoying the barbecue.
Many additional services such as an additonal marquee, catering, decoration, photography, babysitting and more can be arranged by the team.
If you're coming from the UK, this is an excellent choice of wedding destination for its proximity to the channel tunnel as well as Paris and ferry ports. 1h30 de Paris | 1h30 de Lille | 35 mn d’Amiens | 45 mn de l’aéroport de Beauvais
Venue hire starts from 6500 euros for Friday afternoon until Sunday until 7pm. For further information please do get in touch.
